byline.contributor: Palko Karasz reported from Budapest, and Dan Bilefsky from London. Reporting was contributed by Melissa Eddy and Alison Smale from Berlin; James Kanter from Brussels; Aleksandar Dimishkovski from Skopje, Macedonia; and Anemona Hartocollis from Hamburg, Germany.
byline.original: By PALKO KARASZ and DAN BILEFSKY

abstract: Thousands of migrants and refugees from Syria and other Middle Eastern countries endure rain, chaos and misery at various European border crossings; responses from nations vary from welcomes to warnings.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of asylum seekers endured a drenching downpour, the threat of resistance and conflicting messages from Europe about their ability to cross borders.

headline.main: Migrants Meet Rain, Resistance and Confusion at Border Crossings
headline.print_headline: Migrants Meet Rain, Resistance and Confusion at Border Crossings

snippet: Thousands of asylum seekers endured a drenching downpour, the threat of resistance and conflicting messages from Europe about their ability to cross borders.
